title: Who Has The Most Historical Responsibility for Climate Change?
content: The world’s wealthiest nations are disproportionately responsible for global warming. A sticking point at this year’s climate summit: Should they pay for the damage?

title: Menace, as a Political Tool, Enters the Republican Mainstream

content: Of the seven Republicans who found former President Donald J. Trump guilty in his second impeachment trial, the Alaska senator is the only one facing re-election this year.

title: In Border Crisis, Europe’s Unsavory Migration Deals Come Home

title: As Holidays Near, Bosses Try to Coax Vietnam’s Workers Back to Factories
content: Vietnam, one of the world’s largest suppliers of apparel and footwear, is experiencing a labor shortage. Many employees are reluctant to return after a harsh summer lockdown.

title: A Nike Executive Told of Once Killing a Man. Here’s What He Left Out.
